page.title: 07TRACY IN ALBRIGHTON.
page.content: When I went on the visit to the { {Albrighton }area I saw it was mainly farmland.It is gently undulating and sloping to the southwest with some patches of mixed woodland to the northwest.The{A528.}goes through {Albrighton,}it is very busy with traffic going from{Shrewsbury }to { {Ellesmere. { }The village consists of 6 houses,3 farms,{Albrighton Hall }and the chapel.The chapel has a weather cock on top and stone faces on the corners,it is built from reddy brown sandstone. {Albrighton Hall }is very stately indeed, perhaps lords and ladies lived there in the past.It has very tall double chimneys sitting on the roof. The hall farm is right on the main road with many barns and buildings. Tracy Langdon.
